meanings.definition: The highest sails on a ship above the topsails.
meanings.sent1: The topgallants fluttered in the wind as the ship sailed smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The sailors hoisted the topgallants to catch the strong breeze.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous seagull perched on the topgallants, enjoying the view.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams soared high like the topgallants on a majestic ship.
meanings.sent5: The white topgallants against the blue sky painted a beautiful picture.

meanings.definition: A type of sail set above the topsail on a sailing ship.
meanings.sent1: The captain ordered the crew to unfurl the topgallants for more speed.
meanings.sent2: The topgallants billowed gracefully in the ocean breeze.
meanings.sent3: The playful dolphins leaped over the topgallants, showing off their acrobatic skills.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter filled the air like the fluttering topgallants on the ship.
meanings.sent5: The topgallants danced in the wind, guiding the vessel towards its destination.

meanings.definition: The uppermost part of a mast on a sailing ship.
meanings.sent1: The sailors climbed up to the topgallants to get a better view of the horizon.
meanings.sent2: The flag fluttered proudly from the topgallants of the ship.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous monkey swung from the topgallants, causing a commotion.
meanings.sent4: His voice echoed from the topgallants, commanding attention from the crew.
meanings.sent5: The sun set behind the topgallants, casting a golden glow over the sea.
